lines.content: Welcome to Massimo Boi! This guide will help you effectively manage your tasks using various commands. Please follow the instructions below:
There are 3 main types of tasks you can add. To add a task, use the following command format based on the type of task:
Adds a task with only description.
- Replace DESCRIPTION with a word or sentence describing your task.
Adds a task with a specific deadline date.
- Replace DESCRIPTION with a word or sentence describing your task.
- For deadline tasks, include **`/by`** at the end of the description followed by the due date.
Adds a task with a specific from date and to date.
- Replace DESCRIPTION with a word or sentence describing your task.
- For event tasks, include **`/from`** followed by the start date and **`/to`** followed by the end date after the description.
Marks the specified task as done.
- Replace INDEX with the corresponding task index in the list.
- Ensure that the index number exists in the list.
- Replace INDEX with the corresponding task index in the list.
- Ensure that the index number exists in the list.
- Replace INDEX with the corresponding task index in the list.
- Ensure that the index number exists in the list.
Finds all tasks containing the keyword(s) searched for.
- Replace KEYWORDS with the words you would like to search for.
All task details entered are automatically saved when the program terminates. Nothing needs to be done by user.
- To see your saved data, use the `list` command when you first start the app.
Ends the chat with Massimo Boi and terminates the program.
- All task data in task list at time of termination will be saved and available for use next time the program is run.
* @param description the description of the task.
* Returns the task type as Deadline.
* @param description the description of the task.
* @param from the start date (and time) of the task.
* @param to the end date (and time) of the task.
public Event(String description, String from, String to){
* Returns the task type as Event.
* Represents the MassimoBoi chatbot that users can interact with.
* Users can interact using specific commands.
* Creates an instance of the Massimo Boi chatbot.
* @param filename String consisting the name of the file containing users past task list.
System.out.println("The file does not exist. Please create it.");
* The driver function for the chatbot.
* @throws IOException when the file cannot be written to or does not exist and cannot be created.
Parser parser = new Parser(userInput, tasks, ui);
* The function that runs the CLI.
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* Represents a Parser made to handle user commands
* @param userInput the String entered by the user
* @param tasks an arrayList of tasks the user has entered
* @param ui the Ui object containing the printGreetingMessage and printHorizontalRow methods
Parser(String userInput, TaskList tasks, Ui ui){
* Returns a task list that is modified according to user command
* Prints relevant information from tasks to console based on user command
System.out.printf("%s unmarked. Type 'list' to see updated list\n Type mark [list index] to mark this task\n"
System.out.printf("%s marked as done. Type 'list' to see updated list\n Type unmark [list index] to unmark this task\n"
System.out.println("The task number you have tried to mark, unmark, or delete does not exist");
* Handles the storage and loading of task list.
* @param filename the name of the file where the task list is stored.
* Returns the task list previously stored when the program is first loaded.
* @return an arrayList of type Task containing all tasks previously saved by user.
* @throws FileNotFoundException when the file is not found in the specified path.
* Saves all new tasks created by user.
* Saves the tasks in a text file so that they can be loaded next time the program runs.
* @param tasks the list of tasks to be saved.
* @throws IOException when the file cannot be written to or does not exist and cannot be created.
public void addToFile(TaskList tasks) throws IOException {
* Represents a task that the user wishes to complete.
* Creates a new task and marks it as not done.
* @param description the description of the task.
* @return a String [X] when task is done and [] when it is not.
* @return a String containing the task description.
* Returns the task type of the task.
* @return the task type, or [U] if task is not todo, deadline, or event.
* Creates task list to store user's tasks.
* Creates a new TaskList from an existing arrayList of tasks.
* @param taskList the arrayList containing tasks inputted by user.
* Creates a new TaskList with no tasks inside.
* Returns the task at the specified index.
* Adds task to the task list.
* Prints details of the added task including task type, status, and description for user verification.
* @param task the task to be added.
* Deletes the task from the task list.
* Prints details of the deleted task including task type, status, and description for user verification.
* @param task the task to be deleted.
* Prints out the task details in this specific order: type, status, description.
* @param task the task to be printed.
* Prints the newly added task's details and number of tasks in the updated list.
* @param newTask the task that has been newly added
System.out.println("Got it! Ya boi has added: ");
System.out.printf("You now have %d %s in the list\n", taskList.size(), taskList.size() == 1 ? "task" : "tasks");
* Prints the deleted task's details and number of tasks in the updated list.
* @param taskIndex the index of the task to be deleted in the taskList
System.out.printf("You now have %d %s in the list\n", taskList.size()-1, taskList.size() == 1 ? "task" : "tasks");
* Prints the details of all tasks in the task list.
* Prints details in this order: task index, task type, status, description.
* Finds and Prints details of all tasks that match the query string.
* @param query the String being searched for within each task.
* Returns the task type as todo.
* Creates the user interface for the command line.
* Creates a new user interface and stores the logo.
* Prints greeting message along with logo.
* Prints instructions on how to use the program.
To add task, enter the task type (todo,deadline,event) followed by description with following rules:
1. For deadline add {/by} at end of description followed by due date
2. For events add {/from} followed by start date and {/to} followed by end date
To check list of tasks, type list.
To mark a task as done, type mark {list index}.
To unmark a task, type unmark {list index}.
To delete a task, type delete {list index}.
To find a task, type find {key words}.
* Called after user has entered {bye} command.
System.out.println("This is Massimo boi signing out!");
System.out.println("You have an error related to adding a deadline.");
System.out.println("Ma G! You got no description for deadline. Please re-add deadline with description.");
* Handles the case when Event has no description.
System.out.println("Ma G! You got no description for event. Please re-add event with description.");
* Handles the case when todo has no description.
System.out.println("Ma G! Your todo cannot have empty description! Rewrite the todo with description!");
System.out.println("You have an error related to adding an event.");
System.out.println("Your instructions have thrown an error");
* Handles the case when deadline has no due date.
System.out.println("No due date mentioned! After your description type /by {date}");
* Handles the case when Event has no end date mentioned.
System.out.println("No end date mentioned! After your /from {date}, type /to {date}");
* Handles the case when Event has no start date mentioned.
System.out.println("No start date mentioned! After your description type /from {date}");
* Handles the case when user enters a command that is not in the predefined list of commands.
System.out.println("I don't know what that means homie! Use one of the commands listed below: ");
